children.value: My research interest lies at the interface of probability and analysis.
In particular, I am interested in the sharp and quantitative inequalities from probability and analysis, and their applications.
Stability for functional and geometric inequalities and a stochastic representation of fractional integrals and nonlocal operators
My papers on arXiv can be found
On the principal eigenvalue for compound Poisson processes
On discrete second order Riesz transforms
ℓp\ell^pℓp
Collaboration of random walks on graphs
ℓp\ell^pℓp
Fluctuation results for size of the vacant set for random walks on discrete torus
Quantitative inequalities for the expected lifetime of Brownian motion
Instability results for the logarithmic Sobolev inequality and its application to related inequalities
Deficit estimates for the logarithmic Sobolev inequality
Hardy–Stein identity for non-symmetric Lévy processes and Fourier multipliers
Martingale transforms and the Hardy–Littlewood–Sobolev inequality for semigroups
